intro: Gelrebia dauensis, commonly known as the Dauensian bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white petals. The plant typically grows in cool, moist environments, often in shaded forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to habitat loss, Gelrebia dauensis is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
